Reviews.Content: This was a good location in New Orleans, not very far from the St. Charles Streetcar. The rooms seemed outdated and not up to par with the price of the room. The view from our room was looking at another brick building. The pool looked very nice although small. The fitness room was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet New Orleans hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: butterandjelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is perfect - about two blocks outside of the French Quarter so you can easily escape from the noise and chaos but are close enough to walk to nearly every major attraction. The staff was courteous and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the rates were quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: Like they say, "Location, location, location." This hotel is on the edge of New Orleans' central business district and the French Quarter. Just far enough off Bourbon St. to not be crazy or loud, but just a couple of minutes away. All of the tourist areas are within walking distance. The hotel itself is spacious and very quiet. The matresses are adjustable, so you can dial in the firmness on each half of the bed. This made for great sleep! The staff is very friendly and always has suggestions and tips for the out-of-towners. Make sure to catch a cookie at the front desk in the afternoon -- they are yummy! and go up to the top floor pool deck for a nice view of downtown and Bourbon St. The only drawback -- and it is very slight -- is that the hotel occupies the top eight floors of an 18-story building, so the front desk is on the 11th floor. So you're riding elevators all the time. But it is not much of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but lack of attention to detail means you can do better”
Reviews.Author: mholder37
Reviews.Content: For context - I booked two rooms. My first room was on the 14th floor. The good: The room was surprisingly spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and the staff was friendly. The shower was hot and water pressure was plentiful. Checkin was easy and wireless was free and worked well. The location is okay - a 5 minute walk to catch the St. Charles street car. Or a 5 minute walk to Canal Street (cross it and you're in the quarter). These are the most critical things about the hotel, so my non-recommendation is based on what's below. Now for the less important, but the bad: breakfast isn't worth the relatively low cost. Seriously, much of it was not even edible. Sausages were burned. Eggs were swimming in what had to be a cup of salsa. Grits had lumps the size of ping-pong balls. Pre-fixed hot items must be served to you. This means waiting in line behind those asking for custom orders to get something you could easily grab yourself. Took 15-20 minutes to get the food that was mostly bad. My wake-up call came two hours early. Not the end of the world, but I couldn't get back to sleep and was tired all day as I'd been up at the crack of dawn for my inbound flight that morning. The elevators had trouble reading the key cards. We were warned that this was an issue with one elevator at checkin - but the problem was with all elevators. Finally, I booked two non-smoking rooms and was given one non-smoking room, and smoking room, which was disgusting. Changing rooms the first night was impossible as the hotel was full. My colleague ended up in the smoking room, which I didn't find out was smoking until the next day. I would have switched hotels before allowing her to stay in a room that was like sleeping in a bar. The second night the smoking room was switched out for a non-smoking room. That room was fresh and nice, but very hot - the thermostat didn't work to cool down the room. My room was also hot, but I was able to adjust the temp to cool it off just fine. This really an average to nice HGI where a few details were allowed to bloom and overshadow otherwise fine rooms. There are MANY choices in New Orleans, therefore, I recommend you look elsewhere but rest assured that your hotel stay won't be terrible (just unremarkable at best or frustrating at to worst) if you book here.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Alloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay. The rooms were large and clean. The location was great for our needs - between the convention center and Bourbon Street. The staff wasn't helpful for recommending restaurants. I would recommend utilizing Trip Advisor to assist with restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Tieon-P
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving!!! From looking at the pictures on the website I thought we were getting a great room!! My room had a odor of cigarette smoke.The carpet was very dirty. I had to wear my shoes even while in my room. I will never stay in here again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and watch out for the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Sunluvnn
Reviews.Content: Great location and service! However, the costs for the breakfast buffet are misleading. The price varies. Ended up paying $7 for a muffin and a danish. Use the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel... nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: MarkHChicago
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel by about every standard. Check in was smooth, but housekeeping was spotty (stayed three nights, housekeeping only came once). Luckily it was just myself, so it wasn't the end of the world. The rooms were quiet, but my window looked almost directly into another room - so ask for an outside facing room, or be careful to completely close the blackout blinds. The beds were extremely uncomfortable... the adjustable comfort level beds aparrently only go from hard as rock to slightly less hard. Free wireless internet worked well. Overall, could do worse, but I have stayed at 3 other hotels in the same area that would gladly stay at before this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a couple of blocks from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: SPaPP
Reviews.Content: Strangley located with reception on the 11th floor of the building in the CBD. Large lobby/reception area. My room was very comfortable with two big double beds. Breakfast was good. Although only a short walk to Canal Street and then on to Bourbon, New Orleans does not feel a "safe" place to walk around alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linnemj
Reviews.Content: We loved the location for a weekend visit to New Orleans. The hotel is only a short walk to the French Quarter and the St. Charles streetcar. The hotel seems to be behind on upgrading - TVs and business office equiptment is not what you expect in this level hotel. Since the property is above commerical space it is "soul less". There are better choices with character while in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller R
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very clean, updated rooms. Great location, within walking distance of the French Quarter, but close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, you're getting quality basics for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: JoeK49
Reviews.Content: Probably more like 3 1/2 stars. Nice room, 14th floor, good view of downtown/Superdome. Refrigerator and microwave were very handy. Only a few blocks from Bourbon St, an easy walk for anyone without disabilities. Close to the streetcar lines also. In all, a very convenient location. I thought the beds were very comfortable and I slept just fine; not so my girlfriend. Housekeeping was great a couple of days, not so much the other day. Breakfast was just okay, a little pricey compared to what you can get in about 15 mom/pop type places within a block or two. Room service was strange. Wrong menu in the room, not too helpful in making substitutions for what they didn't do any more. But when the food came it was very good. Don't get too excited about the lounge, it is a lobby bar open only a couple hours. The front desk staff were young, enthusiatic about their city and hotel and very helpful and informative. I would stay there again - location can't be beat, it's quiet and the desk people were great. And of course new Orleans is great.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: deaniedapper
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet hotel in CBD close to French Quarter. Appears to be a remodeled office building, nothing spectacular but suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: screenname46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn French Quarter as a solo female traveller, and thought it was great. I had a problem with the online booking company, but the hotel staff were able to sort it out very quickly, and the hotel staff were very friendly generally. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and the hotel is in a great location - about a 1 or 2 min walk from the St Charles and Canal St street cars and the French Quarter. I felt safe walking around the area. The hotel internet was a bit sketchy for a few days while they were upgrading the system, which was frustrating, but was fine after that. There is a coin laundry in the hotel too. The restaurant was ok, but not great, though this didn't bother me as I ate out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Rugger Hugger
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel last Saturday night and were immediately upgraded to a corner suite. The room was outstanding, and the front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. There is valet parking at the hotel. It is a short walk to Bourbon St. and most sites in the French Quarter. We walked to Jackson Square for beignets, and along the waterfront, saw the galleries on Royal St., and never missed our car. It is a good place to stay if you want to experience Bourbon St. madness, but still want a quiet place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good service. Otherwise, pretty average room accomodations...”
Reviews.Author: lcnyc123
Reviews.Content: Great service. Everyone was super friendly to me. Actually, hotel staff was much nicer than other hotels I have stayed at in New Orleans recently (and those were 5-star hotels!)... Hilton Diamond member ... so got breakfast for free. Nice hot made-to-order breakfast. you can get omelettes, eggs, sausage, pancakes, breakfast potatoes, etc. Not sure I would have paid $12.95 for it though ... Room was fairly basic. Nothing fancy. But it was pretty clean. I was on 16th floor and got a good city view... Gym could use some updating / cleaning. only 1 treadmill and it said belt needed to be rewaxed. The elliptical machine looked like it had dried soda on it at the base (at least I hope it was only soda). Hotel didn't have any cleaning wipes to wipe the machines down when done... so just beware of that it you have germ issues. Good view from the gym and the small pool area on 18! This is the kicker .. they have a sign on the in-room safe saying "$3 daily charge to use the safe". Huh? What hotel charges to use the safe?! This after other earlier postings by guests on travel advisor for this hotel warn of stuff missing from rooms? That did not make a good impression on me. I did use the safe, but ultimately at the end of the day, they didn't charge me on my bill... I think this was because I wasn't using the safe when hotel staff came to clean the rooms. So, that's probably when they check. I only used it to put my computer + wallet in when I went to the gym...

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, not nearly as nice as the nearby Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Preds1
Reviews.Content: I booked a couple nights at the HGI FQ last weekend for my family and had a mixed experience. We had booked the Southern Summer Rate. A rate that included valet parking, a movie, popcorn and 2 sodas. We arrived Friday evening around 7:30pm. The valet parking was easy enough, check-in is on the 14th floor. Got there, waited a few minutes to be called on by a pleasant receptionist. So far so good... unfortunately things went downhill from that point forward. I asked about any available upgrades as a Hhonors Diamond member. Was told nothing was available. Kinda a disappointing start, but whatever, unfortunately it was the start of a downward trend. We were offered breakfast coupons we didn't use, and a couple bottles of water. Felt just like a HI minus the nice welcome letters from the GM's with chocolate bars in the room. We were then sent to the pantry to pick out some popcorn and sodas that were included with our rate, only they had no popcorn left (not a big deal), and no diet sodas (ok, so we go with water, again, no biggie), the downward trend continued. We got to our room on the 17th floor (1712), and it was... well, disappointing. The room had a very ordinary, OLD 25"TV with poor reception (I try to avoid hotels that don't have flat panels at a minimum... whoops). The room was worn and dated. Definitely in need of upgrades. The bathroom was flat out terrible. Amongst the worse we've experienced (only beat out by a terrible worn bathroom at the ES Phoenix). The tub had significant scratches that flat out looked grungy, and a large indentation (dent, warp, something weird) in the middle of the tub (not near the drain) that forced you to be careful where you stepped while showering or risk slipping and getting hurt. As for the beds, wow, they were uncomfortable, and my neck still is hurting from the pillows. The first night we couldn't tune in the menu button on the relic of a TV, so we could get a list of available movies to see what the kids could watch with the free movie included in our rate, so set that aside for the next day. I tried using the WIFI to finalize our plans for Saturday, but the connection was terribly slow WIFI. I switched to a corded connection and couldn't get any internet. So settled on the very spotty, slow WIFI. Ultimately giving up entirely for the evening. Saturday I took the family all around New Orleans, and we had a great day riding Segways, walking the Garden District, and enjoying some great meals. Got back to our room around 8 or so with plans to let the kids watch their free movie. The menu system was finally working, so they selected and watched Clash of the Titans. Meanwhile mom and dad crashed early since we had to get up at an ungodly 3:30am to catch an early 6:30am flight out of MSY. We got up the next morning, and were ready to go by about 4am... apparently we were too early to get the checkout bill delivered to the room, so I sent the wife and kids down to get the car from the valet and got off at the 14th floor to check-out at reception. Unfortunately, NOBODY was there. I tried saying HELLO, knocked on the counter, no response. The office door was open behind the counter but there was no sign of life in there, though I couldn't see in too far. I suspect the desk agent was catching a catnap. After 15-20 minutes of making noise and trying to get someones attention, a receptionist finally strolled out of the office. I asked for a copy of my bill to checkout, and the woman tried to charge me for a number of items from the pantry that were sitting on the counter but not mine. Innocent enough mistake I guess (though it tells you that someone got tired of waiting and left). Anyhow, I politely inform her that I just want my receipt, those aren't my items. She printed it up, handed it to me, and to no surprise, it was wrong. I was charged for the movie that was to be included in my rate. I politely advised her that the Southern Summer special rate included valet parking and a movie, and she immediately got defensive and said not that movie. Only movie's $12.99 or less. Huh? Nowhere on the rate did it stipulate a maximum allowed rate. Nor was I advised of that at check-in. So I challenged the validity of that and the receptionist eventually took the illicit charge off my bill. All this time, my wife is texting and calling asking where the heck I am... it was over 30 minutes before I finally got downstairs to meet back up with them. Overall, we enjoyed New Orleans, but didn't enjoy the HGI FQ. The location is decent, but the service is inconsistent, the rooms are dated, and the staff is a mixed back. We've stayed at several other Hilton properties in New Orleans.. I recommend the nearby Homewood Suites on Poydras (had an awesome stay their last summer), or the Hilton Riverside, or if in town for a convention the ES... but I'd suggest avoiding the HGI FQ.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: keut
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, close to the French Quarter (about 3 blocks from Bourbon and Canal). The staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms are fairly large--we requested two queens (one for husband and me; the other for our college-age son), and still had plenty of room. There was a fridge, and a safe. Our room didn't have much of a view, but there's a great one from the rooftop pool and fitness club, and another good one from the lobby which is on the 11th floor (garage takes up the lower floors). The business center with computers very nice; and the lobby bar also nice. We would stay here again next time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: stbeachlover
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a vacation in New Orleans. This hotel's location was perfect. It was close to Bourbon St. without the noise and the craziness. It was clean and their breakfast was very good. We tried to go to the pool which is really small but it was so windy up there on the roof. Our room was quite spacious with a beautiful view of the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again if I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place; thieves have access to your room!”
Reviews.Author: peadles1998
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights just after Easter. We were surprised to find a hair styling flat iron missing after returning to our room. We contacted the hotel manager to report this and got a luke warm response; understandable since it's just a $70 item. Then after checking out my daughter looks through her backpack and finds her iTouch, my MP3 player and other small items were also stolen. We contact the hotel manager again and report the addtitional losses and they tell us they will look into it. Long story short: we are told that only authorized persons went into our room, none of our items can be found and it's just our tough luck that this happened. New Orleans is a fun place to visit, but do not stay at this hotel, the thievery that goes on will sour your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Karluk_10
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hilton Garden Inn because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We rented two king suites for two couples and paid in advance with no refund. The service was great and one of the rooms was fine. The other suite was just so-so. Both were quiet. The pool was crowded and noisy, even though we were between festivals and the hotel was not full. The valet parking was good and at $26 per day was the same as other hotels. The hotel was within easy walking distance of the French Quarter and the St. Charles streetcar to the Garden District. Also, close to the Roosevelt Hotel, which is worth a trip to the Sazerac Bar and the Blue Room.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and handy”
Reviews.Author: brissotravellers
Reviews.Content: Good location being just out of the French Quarter (no noise problems late at night) but close enough to be an easy walk. Its on a small street which may be a bit of a concern for some at night but we had no problems and felt safe. The rooms are quiet large and well mainatained. Clean, comfortable with all the faculties we needed. Being located above floor 11 the rooms are quiet and have all the facilies needed. Decor is a little dated but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walkers”
Reviews.Author: TagAl0ngWife
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel where we could park our car and walk everywhere. This unique hotel has the lobby on the 11th floor with rooms above, and the floors below are all parking. We put in our car when we got there Saturday afternoon and didn't use it again until we left on Tuesday morning. It's an easy walk to the French Quarter, the Riverfront area, the Superdome, and the Canal St. streetcar line which will take you to the WWII museum & Garden District. The $26/night parking fee was reasonable and we would have easily spent that much to park in the various attractions if we had to drive there. The hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay. We didn't have a view from our window, but we went up onto the roof where there is a very tiny pool, and were able to look out over the city. There were no non-smoking rooms available so we accepted a smoking room, but the smell was minimal. We would definitely recommend it to our friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “You can always count on this chain and this one was the best of the chain I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: KCandAJ
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful. They were very prompt and assisted me with everything I needed. I lost my phone charger and they even assisted me with trying to find one that would work in their lost and found and when we could not they looked online and located the area stores that sold a charger that would work on my phone and even compared prices at each location. Each dining recommendation they made was fantastic. My room was very spacious and clean. The location is very near the French Quarter but located in the CBD which was perfect as I was there for work and could conduct my meetings in the day and then take a short walk to the Quarter for dinner but also avoid the noise during late night. I'm in New Orleans 3-4 times a year for work and will check availablity at this location for every future visit. I learned a valuable lesson on this trip to stay somewhere you can trust and I won't forget it in the future. Most Hilton locations and certainly this one are somewhere you can trust for a quality stay. Roof top pool was also very nice. It's heated and I was able to enjoy it on a 60 degree day.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, restful place to stay that is close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: hitagacamper
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with one son and his family(wife and 15 mo. old child) and adult daughter and her boyfriend. We wanted non smoking king rooms. We found this hotel was all it advertized to be. The valet parking seemed expensive, but we found it to be excellent and very secure. The staff at the hotel were excellent and attentive. The breakfast met everyone's needs. It is not located in the French Quarter, but is close and walking could be an option. It is within an easy walk of the World War II Museum and the Aquarium. We thought something was missing from one of our cars and the hotel responded to our inquires and followed-up on everything. It turned out the item had been misplaced and we called the hotel and told them we found the lost items and thanked them for all their help in the matter. We were very impressed by their due diligence in the entire situation. The pool is an outdoor pool, but it is heated so we were able to swim in comfort even though the temperatures were cool.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the budget minded”
Reviews.Author: PeghandleMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November since the price was right we stayed here again in February just after Mardis Gras. Normally, we are able to check in early however on this trip we were told to come back at 3pm. We were able to check our luggage and return later without a hassle. We did encounter a problem with the cooling system in our room. The thermometer read 68 degree but it was clearly closer to 78. This concern was addressed promptly. We did have the exact same problem when we stayed in November. The rooms are clean and comfortable. They provide free wi fi. They cater to the business clientelle so it's nothing fancy. There is a mini fridge and microwave. The hotel itself was very quite. We did encounter a noise problem whenever someone took a shower/flushed it made a loud noise of rushing water for the duration. Like woke us up at 4:30am. Valet parking was exceptional.( Yet pricey) My wife left her phone in the car and the attendant litterally ran up and retrieved her phone promptly. When we checked out the car was waiting for us by the time we got down on the elevator. The hotel is on the quiet side of Canal St which is a big plus. The drawback can be location for some who don't enjoy the walk. An additonal problem is If you're in the middle of the Quarter and decide I should have grabbed my coat you have to hike back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and comfortable bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: katpatpas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton for 3 nights to see the Mardi Gras parades and for the Super Bowl game. The staff could not have been better, We arrived at 9:30 a.m. and had requested early check-in. We were upgraded to a suite with a couch and were checked in immediately. The Super Bowl party in the hotel lobby was very enjoyable and every staff member from the restaurant to the front desk clerks, to the housekeepers, and the parking attendants were wonderful, courteous and helpful. We have stayed at this hotel previously and will definitely stay again. The breakfast buffet was delicious as was the dinner menu. The bed was very comfortable also. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Supergras-super hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbwhit
Reviews.Content: A couple blocks from Canal and Bourbon. We never mind the walking; makes up for all the eating! Quiet...unless you have Super Bowl/Mardi Gras party animals next door, like we had one morning :) The room was plenty big and it had fridge and microwave (plus!). Staff was accommodating and hotel amenities were great. The roof top pool (heated to hot tub temperature!) was awesome as well as the view!

Reviews.Title: “Staff: Excellent - Management: Friendly but NOT well organized or staffed”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: As a leisure traveler, you will find that this hotel MORE than meets your needs. The rooms are clean and spacious, the front desk staff is warm and accomodating, and the amenities a cut above many hotels (i.e. microwaves, refrigerators). HOWEVER (there is always a HOWEVER), if you are a frequent or business traveler, and you have certain standards that are not negotiable - you may want to pass on this location. We arrived on a Sunday at 2:00 PM to find our room not ready; annoying but understandable since their posted check-in time is 3:00 PM. I asked the desk clerk when it might become available, and she said that she had to check with housekeeping (okay, understandable). She radioed and radioed, with no response. Finally, she dialed an extension, and the person on the other end of the line evidently told her to radio - which produced the same result. Frustrated, I just stood at the counter until she got it resolved. We got into our room at about 2:30. Meanwhile, I had asked that a manager call me - because there was none on site (WHAT??!! - NO MANAGER at the hotel???). A manager did call, and she was contrite, and understood the frustration - and explained that the radios don't work all that well in an old building (solution: don't use them, use cell phones instead; I had 4 bars). They comped a movie and snacks for my son - I appreciated that effort. So, if you are a type-B traveler (easy going), you will really like this place - it's close to the French Quarter, the staff is accommodating, the rates seem reasonable. But, if you are more of a Type-A, the minimal staffing and lack of constant on-site leadership might get under your skin. There was nothing that would keep me from returning, although I might contact the hotel in advance to make sure that everything is on track. Mariana, the desk clerk is a GEM!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, great location and outstanding amenities A+.”
Reviews.Author: luv2shopntravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for shopping and walking distance to all the excitement on canal and bourbon street. In addition, walking distance to Harrah's casino, Aquarium of the Americas and River walk. This hotel has an outstanding staff. At five in the evening, home made cookies along with fruits are free to the customers. There were no fees for late check out or for the use of the hotel's computer using thier internet.services.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JHallermann
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful, the staff was very helpful and nice. The rooms were amazing with very comfortable king size bed, with flat screen TV. There's 18 floors with a pool on the roof over looking the French Quarter. Wonderful breakfast in the morning everything you could ask for in a hotel. Especially on your honeymoon!! PERFECT!! I would most definitely recommend. Only a five min. walk to Rue Bourbon. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Call Home in the Big Easy!”
Reviews.Author: 007CubsFan
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews here before booking my trip. I arrived a bit early but they were happy to let me check in. The front desk staff were very friendly, pleasant and professional. They gave me an upgrade to a mini suit, which was nice. I took pics of the room. I was on the 16th of 18 floor - I like it high up!! The room was nice and cozy, with a microwave and mini fridge - great to have some snacks. The view could have been better. The bed and bedding were amazing! Very comfortable - I did not want to get out of bed in the morning. Everything was clean and it working order. The furnishings were a bit old and dated but that was okay. The pool is small but heated, out doors and on the 18th floor! Check it out - nice view of the city! Nice small gym too. Breakfast was good - they make about whatever you want and it is all one price. Free wired internet and free WiFi through out the property! Location was also great - about 3 blocks from the French Quarter so very easy to get around and see the city! I would certainly return to this location and it is by far superior to the Doubletree and Hilton which I have also reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with only ONE problem.”
Reviews.Author: Mikafe
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden Inn is a great hotel. The location couldn't be better because being in the Business District of New Orleans makes it more affordable than the hotels of the same category that are located in the French Quarter. At the same time, it's just 2 blocks from the French quarter, so it's perfect for someone who is going to visit New Orleans for either leisure or business. The hotel is elegant, the staff is great and the rooms are very comfortable. One thing that makes it different from all the other hotels I have visited is the fact that it is built on top of a parking building. The administration offices and front desk are situated on the 11th floor! . That probably makes the hotel safer and also the fact that in order to use the elevator the use of a card is needed, so no stranger can go to the hotel floors. It has a nice restaurant. We only had breakfast there but it also offers lunch and dinner. Breakfast was very good and the staff was really friendly. I can't find anything I didn't like about this hotel as far as service, room, staff is concerned. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that every guest HAS to use the valet parking service. There's NO other choice and it is NOT cheap. As a matter of fact, it was very expensive in my opinion. We paid $26 per night, even though we didn't use the car everyday and it stayed parked most of the time we spent at the hotel. This, of course, made our stay more expensive that we expected. This is the reason why I gave a rate of only 4 for 'value'.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is almost nice, isn't it?”
Reviews.Author: beadro
Reviews.Content: Great service, overall happy with the hotel. Stayed on the business level, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gmk1214
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, close, but not too close, to the French Quarter. Street Car stop 1/2 block away. The desk attendants, although very friendly, knew very little about the city they were in, in regards to transportation, restaurants, sightseeing. As this was our first trip to New Orleans, we we sort of hoping for better information. The A/C in the room never seemed to be quite cool enough, so beware if you are traveling in the summertime. All in all, for the money (we went for JazzFest), a good deal, walking distance to the French Quarter and seemed to be in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Take advantage of amenities not advertized.”
Reviews.Author: bronco_5
Reviews.Content: First of all...do yourself a favor and if you have a car, take the valet service. Now, whether or not you have a car, do yourself a favor and use the massage chair in the garage area. It's there for you to enjoy. I wasn't sure, so I went and sat in it. When a parking attendant came by, I asked if it was a problem that I was there. He stated, 'That's why it's here, for the customers.' I used it everyday. Hotel was quiet and the room was clean. I had a bathtub that was backing up and called about it. Within minutes, maintenace was there to fix it. Great JOB! Another bonus - Free Internet! Here's the bad....First, the ice machines don't work on every floor, so you'll have to go to the floor with the working ice machine. Not a biggie in my book. Second thing....Don't bother with the breakfast on the 11th floor. I went and looked...horrible.

Reviews.Title: “An average stay at a Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: KeeKeex2
Reviews.Content: A friend and I chose to stay here because of Hilton membership, and the rate wasn't bad either. We also chose to stay here because of other reviews on tripadvisor and from the said location (only a few block from the french quater). The hotel itself was unique, quiet, and clean. The rooms were very basic and somewhat on the small side, but we weren't in NOLA to stay in the room. In any case, I was happy with the cleanliness of the room and the fact that it had a small refridge and microwave. The website states that the hotel is only a few blocks from the French Quater, which it is. However, as two females in our mid twenties, we did not feel safe walking to the french quarter from the hotel during the daytime. We knew to take a cab at night, but even the day time walk made us feel uncomfortable. Also, I had gone to NOLA to experience the culture side of it and not necessarily to stumble back to my room at 3am. From the location of the hotel, I would have preferred to stay near the water which also seemed to be a much cleaner and more upscale area of the french quarter. In any case, if you are a traveler looking for the party scene, this place may just work for you. If you prefer to see the sights and enjoy the food in a cleaner part of town, I would recommend that you stay near the water. All in all, I wouldn't stay at the hotel again, but at no fault of the hotel's. After a small incident with our trip, we had to check out a few days early. The staff was very understanding and made it a smooth transaction. We drove to NO and parked our car at the valet service at the hotel. Each day is around $29 including tax. When we checked out, we paid our days for the valet and left. However, a few weeks later, we received a charge on the credit card from the valet service at the hotel for the remainder of our original stay. In other words, we were charged for our car being parked there after we had already driven home. We immediately contacted the hotel, and they credited the account without any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Pete--from---NYC
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Hilton Garden Inn New Orleans French Quarter/CBD. It was a great stay. The Hilton is clean, with large open rooms. This was the quietest hotel stay I have have in a while , with no hallway, wall, or outside noise. The hotel is well situated for the French Quarter, and for Harrah's. It is a few blocks from the French Quarter, but a nice break from the noise/action of Bourbon Street. The rooftop pool is tiny, but we spent some time on the roof hanging out.. While you are in the FQ, be sure to hit the Acme Oyster company for a lunch/dinner, and NOLA for a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Hilton Garden Inn in terms of service - very poor”
Reviews.Author: spregflyer
Reviews.Content: After arriving and not being impressed by the hotel, the manager actually argued with me. The check-in person was great, but for some reason the manager has issues with any kind of discounted rate (I'm an airline employee). If we had better sense we would have gone somewhere else. The rooms are OK and clean but just basic when compared to other hotels at similar prices. The location is a couple blocks off Bourbon Street but the street and parking ramp is really run down. The breakfast staff could definitely use some customer service training, but then again considering the manager, they are par for the course. We stayed a couple nights here and really wished we stayed elsewhere. After not being able to make it on our flight out of MSY, we ended up staying another night in New Orleans and we stayed at the Crowne Plaza Astor - a much better hotel all the way around and the rate is not that much higher. I would recommend you stay there rather than the HGI.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: skurny
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I just spent the weekend here and overall, it was a good stay. It's on a quiet street just off Canal, which is great because there wasn't traffic on the street or screaming drunk people at 5am. They also gave me some complimentary breakfast coupons for the friends staying with me, which was a nice touch. There were a few small disappointments, though. First, the mini-fridge in our room didn't work. I called the front desk and they had someone up to the room within 15 minutes to remove it...about 5 minutes later he returned with a working one. Problem solved efficiently. Second, the ice machines on 12 and 13 were both down so we had to go to the Hotel Bar to get ice...not a huge issue but a bit inconvienent. Third, the "pool" on the roof is more like an oversize hot tub without the jets. The view is nice and my friends and I had drinks up there one night before dinner. Don't plan on doing a lot of swimming at the hotel, though. Then again, it's New Orleans and you should spend your time walking around, eating and drinking...not swimming in the hotel pool! The staff was friendly and the weekend rates were cheap ($95 a night). The hotel was clean and I'd recommend it and stay there again. Positive: Location, Quiet, Clean, Friendly Staff Negative: Fridge, Ice Machine

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelPublisher
Reviews.Content: At first glance, an odd property since you really never see the hotel and enter through the garage with hotel occupying top floors of old office building. I visit New Orleans often and prefer staying near but not in the French Quarter and there are plenty of hotel options that fit this description but for the location and price you will be hard pressed to find a better option than the Hilton Garden Inn. Very pleasant and helpful staff, and extremely well managed property that offers all the amenities of typical Hilton Garden Inn brand including free wireless internet, and breakfast. Parking here is very expensive at $30 a night with seems excessive to me but generally on par with other city garages. Rooms are very clean, and modern but small work out room share the top floor of property adjacent to small rooftop outdoor pool. Location is great only blocks from French Quarter, Poydras, and Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hilton Garden Inn in the French Quarter. I booked it primarily because of the price (around 90.00) and since I had stayed there once before and I am a Hilton Diamond Member I knew what to expect. The hotel is kind of secluded, so be careful or you will pass right by it on the narrow one way street it is located on. Valet parking only is kind of expensive, although not as much as the Doubletree just a couple of blocks down. Lobby is on the 11th floor, and the rooms are from 12 on up. It strikes me odd that you can do a daily park there as a tourist for 6 to 10 dollars a day, but as a guest it was 28.00, plus tax. But with the low rate I didnt see a reason to complain. Hotel check in was fast and friendly. Room was clean, nice, and quiet with a slight view of the water. Breakfast was good, and as a diamond member it was complimentary. I don't know if I would have paid 10.00 for it. Valet was quick to bring the car down and assisted with luggage. Harrahs Casino is only about a 4 block walk and Canal Street if only about 2 blocks away. I would definitely stay here again if I could get the same low rate, even with the parking feee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not Quite in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NUCat_in_TN
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel when we came to New Orleans for a graduation (got a group rate of $99). The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff was polite. However, if you try to check in early and they say they will call you when your room is ready, don't believe them. PLEASE NOTE: This hotel is NOT in the French Quarter - it is about 3 or 4 blocks west of Canal Street. It is an advantage because it quiet. It is a disadvantage because there is nothing around. If you want something quick for breakfast, something from Starbucks or an ATM, you'll need to go for a walk unless you want to eat at the in-hotel "restaurant", which will charge you an arm and a leg for a bagel and a Coke. Also note that parking is about $25/day - about standard for NOLA. I would stay again but would bring walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “A Strange Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: flyonblue
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is located on a side street of Canal Street. Though this is very close to the French Quarter itself, the somewhat sketchy walk through these side streets made me wary of staying there alone. Beside its location, the hotel and its staff were wonderful. There was a tendency for loud yelling at 3am in the morning as college-age students returned from their shenanigans on Burbon Street. I would recommend this hotel if you have someone to stay and walk with and if you can get a special deal that includes free parking (it is a 26 dollar fee otherwise).

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: mtbk
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean place to stay if you don't want to pay the high price of the French Quarter. We stayed for 6 nights so the fridge and microwave came in handy. The staff could have had better knowledge of the streetcars and a little better at directions but we had maps and were able to get around fine. We ate at the restaurant twice because everything around the hotel closes by 2 pm and we didn't feel like going back into the French Quarter. We both liked our meals but we also had enough sense not to expect a top notch meal. We ordered sandwiches and salads. We had a different waitress both times and thought they were great. My only complaint is the room wasn't cool enough. They did send someone and it got a little cooler. They called a few hours later to make sure we were happy and to see if we needed anything else. I felt it still was a little warm for me to sleep but since I'm from New England and used to cold nights I figured it was more my problem than theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: seayou99
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel although the location is a little misleading. The property is actually in the central business district about 1-2 blocks from canal street which is the western edge of the French quarter. I felt safe in this area and it was a bit of a hike to the converntion center, my place of business at the time. The hotel lobby is located on the 12th floor which is a bit odd but it works. The rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast with omlet station is just fine. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A not so bad hotel in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: tapebackup
Reviews.Content: I just was in this hotel for a week. Overall, I would say it's an "averagely nice" place to stay in New Orleans. On the positive side, the rooms are quite big, well equipped and clean. The beds are nice and comfortable. The room had a small fridge as well as a microwave oven (although I used none of them). Also, the hotel is quite conveniently located, very close but not inside the (noisy) French quarter. The staff at the reception was professional and efficient. However, everything was not perfect. First, the internet connection was *amazingly* slow. Both wired and wireless connectivity was available, and both were slow. Moreover, the wireless signal was very weak in most of the room. Food taken at the hotel's restaurant was really "average" and the restaurant staff was really painfully slow. In summary, this hotel is not extraordinary, but if all you need is a simple place to stay then it's probably a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but don't eat here!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Lon
Reviews.Content: OK, now this was my first time in New Orleans so I took a bit of a flyer on the hotel. Location was good, quiet and just off the main Canal St and close to Bourbon St (without the noise) - I don't think in hindsight I would stay anywhere too close to Bourbon... Hotel was clean and easy to find and I would stay there again, price was reasonable at $159 a night however there were a few niggles. Firstly, there is a compulsory $2.50 charge per day for having a safe in your room. C'mon people, be honest - just add it to the total room charge upfront. This is just cheeky. Also, we had problem with never getting shampoo as the cleaning staff couldn't read the labels in English and got the mouthwash confused with shampoo. I know this because we asked them! Finally, whatever you do, do not eat at the 'Great American Grill' their in house restaurant. The food is very very poor, overpriced and the service dreadful. The waiter and waitress had to call over the manager to open our wine because they had never used a corkscrew before!!!! The steak was so over cooked I felt like re-soleing my shoe. No, no, whatever you do go out and eat. Food and service aside I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: misitemd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in New Orleans. The location is great - a few blocks from Canal and Bourban Streets. We had a corner suite with a king bed. We had lots of windows with great views. The room was very clean! Parking was $26 per day. We would certainly stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MayYeah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight at the HGI CBD/French Quarter on December 30, 2007 and was pleasantly surprised with our accomodations given our rate of $84 plus $26 for parking. The size of our standard king room was exceptionally large by New Orleans standards and comparable to what you find in new construction HGI's around the country. The hotel is a conversion and not very welcoming from the street level entrance which is a parking garage. However, once you reach the lobby via the elevator to the 9th floor, you know you are in an HGI with the exception of a much larger common area than most. I can attest to the earlier reviews that the location is both quiet and convenient. In fact, Harrahs is only four blocks and the French Quarter maybe three. The pool area on the roof provides a nice view of the city and the smallesh fitness center overlooking the terrace is a nice touch. There is very litte wear on this hotel at least on the surface. What a deal for $84 and in New Orleans during peak nights a deal for at least twice that. Oh, did I mention they threw in free breakfast for my wife and I given my Gold Hilton HHonors status? The only problem we experienced was a fussy thermostat that resulted in us waking to a warmer than desired room. After fooling with it a while, things cooled off. Not a big deal to this frequent traveler who has experienced his share of problem temperature controls in hotels costing 3 to 4 times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGKDH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a weekend stay. We had a large, clean room. It is not a luxury hotel but this was fine for us because we were not spending a lot of time in the hotel. There is a great view of the city from the pool at the top of the hotel. I would recommend this for business travelers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Smart40
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn on Gravier was a life saver for me and my family. During the Bayou Classic I had to find a place to stay after arriving a another very disappointing hotel, I called the Hilton and they were able to accomodate us. Check in was quick and very courteous. I felt very secure with my children because you have to have key card entrance to the floors. The rooms were immaculate. I could say so much more, but to sum it all up I was very pleased and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaF
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The first time was Mardi Gras 2005. The location is conveniently located to the French Quarter--two blocks from Canal St and 1/2 block from Carondelet which becomes Bourbon across Canal. Rooms are a good size. Very clean. Very quiet. Beautiful view of New Orleans from the roof patio/pool area. Only downside is that the restaurants across the street from the hotel are not open during the weekend as this area is the business district. There is a restaurant in the hotel open for breakfast and lunch. We used it for breakfast the last visit and it was fine. Service was a little slow. For those thinking of coming to Mardi Gras 2008, remember that Canal St is usually closed due to the parades. If you are staying in the quarter, your cab will have to drop you off at Canal St and you will have to drag your luggage across the street to the many hotels. While it might be fun staying in the quarter if you are on 24 hour party mode, its much quieter at the HIlton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: travelinillinois
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here over the weekend with my teenage son and adult niece. Good location - only a few blocks walk to the heart of Bourbon street. We got a great rate when we booked on the website. The rooms are large - there was plenty of space for the 3 of us. Beds are very comfortable. The entire hotel - lobby, hallways and rooms were all clean - looked almost new. It was so quiet it was hard to tell if there were other guests on our floor. Housekeeping was great - you couldn't tell they were on the floor until you saw their cart. We went out on Saturday a.m. and when we returned, in addition to cleaning our room houskeeping had neatly lined our shoes along the wall, placed our toothbrushes in a glass and organized our toiletries on the bathroom counter. We did eat breakfast at the grill there - buffet is $10.95 - and they make omelets, pancakes, french toast, etc. to order. The staff there is very friendly and attentive. Also this is one of very few hotels there that offer free high speed internet in the room. I would recommend this hotel for a great stay that is close enough but not in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay during Jazzfest”
Reviews.Author: Hortkie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a nice quiet almost hidden gem. Stayed here for 2nd weekend of jazzfest. Easy walk to Harrahs, stinky bourbon st., plenty of cabs drive by, friendly staff, nice free breakfast (diamond hhonors benny) , room always made up nice when I returned, small pool but had it all for rmyself - just right. Small little bar for a quick drink and good bartender. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: intl_realist
Reviews.Content: We choose the Hilton Garden Inn as our pre-cruise hotel. Everything about the hotel was to our liking. Check-in was a breeze; the rooms were clean and spacious. Internet was free. And, of course, the hotel was a short walk from the French Quarter and the Riverfront. My only disappointment with the hotel was the fact that the fitness facility was small and many of the machines were broken and the outdoor heated pool was filled with dirt and debris. Other than that the hotel was great and we will definitely be staying here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn New Orleans French Quarter/CBD
HotelInfo.Address: 821 Gravier Street, New Orleans, LA 70112
